Comments_List: Exposure to many tasks in NLP and practical applications through the assignments.
Board knowledge from the natural language processing!
Basic NLP knowledge and algorithms and Deep learning application for NLP
dependency / lexicalized parsing, sequence tagging, HMM, Naive Bayes, EM, RNN, LSTM, GRU, semantic parsing, text classification
NLP
get a better understanding of all the NLP tasks, including HMM, naive bayes, neural networks, and so on.
Basic skills on NLP. The class was intriguing also for the lectures on the linguistics.
I have learned the basics of Natural Language Processing.

The course covers a broad spectrum of topics, which is good for exposure. I feel the course would have been better if it had chosen to focus on tensorflow or pytorch rather than switch from one to the other between assignments.
Exam overwhelming. Ask about random person.
The homework of this course is interesting and I can learn a lot from the homework.

strength: broad topics, clear content and helpful assignment to help better understand.
weakness: perhaps a final project will be helpful too.

strength: interesting and cover a lot of material
weakness: survey class so not dive into detail

The class covered a wide range of topics and it was interesting even for non-CS backgrounds. The homework was strongly correlated to the class, and it was very helpful for understanding the topics.

Weakness may be that it covered a lot of topics so that some didn't have enough examples to understand, although the reading list was pretty helpful.
This course is a survey of the main areas and algorithms used in Natural Language Processing. It provides very limited knowledge. It has some broadness, but lacks depth.
Yes, good introduction to a very popular area.
Exam too ridiculous.
Highly recommended!
I would recommend this course to another student because it can help students to learn more about both language itself and techniques for language processing.
Yes. The course is vsery helpful
Kind of. If you are interested in NLP you should definitely choose it. But if you are not it is hard to drive yourself into a large number of readings
Yes, if you want to learn some NLP knowledge, this course is good for you.
Yes, totally. As long as students know how to code Python, the class should be very stimulating and insightful.
No. A student can just learn the same stuff by himself/herself with some open materials on the Internet.
